New Records: Pablo López became the ninth Twins pitcher to reach 200 strikeouts in a season.
Pablo López shattered his own record with 14 strikeouts in a game, surpassing his previous record of 12.
Key Match Events: Pablo López pitched eight dominant innings, allowing only two hits.
The Twins threatened in the bottom of the ninth but couldn't convert on the opportunity.
Griffin Jax allowed two runs in the ninth inning, spoiling López's performance.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Rocco Baldelli praised López's performance, calling it 'beyond dominant.'
Post-Match Reflections: López mentioned that reaching 200 strikeouts is a main goal for starters every season and that it means a lot to him.
Baldelli said that López is having a 'hell of a year' and is at his best in September.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins drew six walks in the game but were unable to push a run of support across for López.
The Twins won the series 2-1 despite the loss.
Others: López soaked in the appreciation from fans and raised his fist to them as he walked off to a standing ovation.
López finished with a career-high 14 swings-and-misses in the effort.
